titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Kenneth Rush Papers, 1937-1989
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1997 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches, memoranda, interview transcripts, financial records, and printed matter, relating to United States foreign relations with Germany and France, the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, and United States foreign, economic, and defense policy during the administrations of Richard M. Nixon and Gerald R. Ford.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kenneth Rush Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1985.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: B. A. degree, the University of Tennessee
Assistant Professor, Duke University Law School
U.S. Ambassador to the Federal German Republic
Counsellor to the President for Economic Policy
Chairman, The Atlantic Council of the United States

arrangement.p: Correspondence, printed matter and reports arranged by form.
Personnel questionnaires and speeches arranged by form.

did.unittitle: OFFICE FILE, U.S. EMBASSY, GERMANY, JULY 1969-FEBRUARY 1972

arrangement.p: Clippings and speeches and writings arranged by form.

arrangement.p: Speeches and writings, correspondence and schedule arranged by form.

arrangement.p: Subject files and speeches and writings arranged by form.

arrangement.p: Appointments, correspondence, speeches and writings arranged by form.

did.unittitle: OFFICE FILE, U. S. EMBASSY, FRANCE, NOVEMBER 1974-MARCH 1977

arrangement.p: Personal file, correspondence and speeches and writings arranged by form.

Business Advisory Committee for Nixon-Agnew. Relates to the 1968 presidential campaign of Richard M. Nixon
OFFICE FILE, U.S. EMBASSY, GERMANY, JULY 1969-FEBRUARY 1972
Letters on signing of the Berlin Four Power Talks Agreement, August, September 1971. Photocopies

OFFICE FILE, DEPUTY SECRETARY OF STATE, FEBRUARY 1973-MAY 1974
Appointments book, 1974. Includes Kenneth Rush's positions as Deputy Secretary of State, Counsellor to the President for Economic Policy and Ambassador to France
Guest lists for functions hosted by Mr. and Mrs. Rush
Memoranda of conversations and reporting cables
Speeches and writings. Typescript unless otherwise indicated
Parting remarks to Ambassador Ushiba, n.d.

"The United States and the Changing World," remarks to Fulbright-Hays scholars honored by the Department of State and the Washington International Center, March 21, 1973. Printed copy in Department of State Bulletin, May 1973
